Title: SoftBank Founder Masayoshi Son Lost $130 Million on Bitcoin
Summary: Masayoshi Son made a huge personal bet on bitcoin just as prices peaked, losing more than $130 million when he sold out.

Title: Big Bitcoin Exchange Ends Bid to Lure High-Speed Traders
Summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase is ending an ambitious effort to win over high-frequency traders, the latest sign that bitcoin companies are having trouble attracting mainstream financial players.

Title: Treasury Bureau Issues First Penalty for Peer-to-Peer Digital Currency Exchange
Summary: The Treasury Department’s financial crimes unit fined a California man it accused of violating anti-money-laundering laws, saying he exchanged bitcoins hundreds of times on behalf of customers without a license.

Title: Private-Jet Cryptocurrency Gets Pass From SEC
Summary: A private-jet company won the ability to sell a digital token that doesn’t require oversight by financial regulators. The hitch: The token won’t operate like others, diminishing its allure to fans of cryptocurrencies.

Title: Bitcoin Rises 16%, Touching $5,000 in Asia
Summary: Bitcoin prices rose 16% in New York, the largest percentage gain there since December 2017. In Asia, the digital currency topped $5,000 for the first time this year.

Title: Raising Money in the Crypto World Has Gotten a Lot Harder
Summary: The market for initial coin offerings, which boomed last year after the surge in bitcoin and other digital currencies, has fallen sharply in 2019 amid a regulatory crackdown.

Title: Coinbase’s New Customer Incentive: Interest Payments, With a Crypto Twist
Summary: Coinbase, a platform where users can buy and sell bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, is launching a program for institutional investors that will pay them a set interest rate, likely up to 8%, when they park money there.

Title: Bitcoin in the Wilderness
Summary: On a Canadian oil field, natural gas with nowhere to go powers a bitcoin-mining operation.

Title: Cryptocurrency Miner Bitmain’s Hong Kong IPO Application Lapses
Summary: Bitmain Technologies, the world’s largest cryptocurrency mining company, said it plans to go public in the future after a six-month deadline on its current listing application lapsed.

Title: Most Bitcoin Trading Faked by Unregulated Exchanges, Study Finds
Summary: Nearly 95% of all reported trading in bitcoin is artificially created by unregulated exchanges, a new study concludes, raising fresh doubts about the nascent market following a steep decline in prices over the past year.

Title: Bitcoin Futures Launch Hits Regulatory Snag
Summary: A plan by New York Stock Exchange-parent Intercontinental Exchange to launch the first physically-settled bitcoin futures contract has hit a regulatory snag.

Title: Bitcoin Is in the Dumps, Spreading Gloom Over Crypto World
Summary: Bitcoin is in the longest slump of its 10-year history, forcing supporters to shelve dreams of global disruption and focus simply on outlasting the downturn.

Title: Cboe Abandons Bitcoin Futures
Summary: Cboe Global Markets has pulled the plug on bitcoin futures, the latest sign that mainstream financial firms are losing their enthusiasm for cryptocurrencies.

Title: Former Mt. Gox Bitcoin Bigwig Unlikely to Do More Jail Time After Beating Embezzlement Charges
Summary: The former chief of the collapsed Mt. Gox bitcoin exchange, once the world’s biggest, won a not-guilty verdict Friday on the more serious charges against him and was given a sentence that probably won’t include prison time.

Title: ‘Our Cash Went to Something’: Customers Hunt for Bankrupt Crypto Exchange’s Missing Millions
Summary: An unusual cash-pickup system is the latest unusual business practice at Quadriga to emerge since Gerald Cotten, the firm’s 30-year-old co-founder and CEO, died in India late last year.

Title: A Crypto-Mystery: Is $136 Million Stuck or Missing?
Summary: Canadian cryptocurrency exchange Quadriga says customers’ holdings are trapped in an electronic vault after the firm’s founder died without revealing the access keys to unlock his laptop. Two researchers, though, say the money might be missing.

Title: AMD Guides for Slower Growth This Year
Summary: Advanced Micro Devices expects revenue this year to grow at a more conservative pace as the chip maker faces weaker sales of graphics processors with the cooling of a once-hot cryptocurrency market.

Title: Two Groups Account for $1 Billion in Cryptocurrency Hacks, New Report Says
Summary: According to Chainalysis, the two entities, which are likely still active, employed an extensive network of digital wallets to hide their tracks and later converted the money to physical cash through online exchanges and individual transactions.

Title: Are ICO Tokens Securities? Startup Wants a Judge to Decide
Summary: Canadian startup Kik Interactive plans to challenge Washington’s ability to regulate the fledgling cryptocurrency industry.

Title: Outsmart the Scammers: How You Can Avoid Fraud
Summary: More Americans are falling victim to financial fraud, as scammers excel at identifying victims’ weaknesses and insecurities; learn to identify the signs of a scam to protect yourself.

Title: Meet the Watchdog Called CryptoMom
Summary: Hester Peirce, a Republican member of the SEC with libertarian leanings, has won fans in the cryptocurrency community with her approach to regulating the market.

Title: In a World Without Hard Cash, What’s Left To Steal?
Summary: Bills and pocket change are fading. ‘A Fistful of Bitcoin,’ anyone?

Title: Crypto’s 2019 Goal: Technology People Can Use
Summary: Bitcoin slumped about 70% in 2018, erasing $160 billion of digital wealth in a move that exposed the cryptocurrency market’s shaky footing.

Title: Once a Rebel, Bitcoin Is Conforming to Mainstream Markets
Summary: Capital and investors from traditional markets have flowed into cryptocurrencies, making some of them behave like traditional assets—just far, far riskier.

Title: Make The Most of Your Failed Bitcoin Gamble: Sell Now
Summary: The popping of the crypto bubble has been painful, but a quick sale (and repurchase, if you choose) before the end of the year may lower your taxes

Title: First Futures Contract to Pay Out in Bitcoin Poised for Green Light
Summary: The first futures contract that will pay out in cryptocurrency rather than cash is expected to soon get regulatory approval.

Title: Blythe Masters, a Former Wall Street Star, Resigns From Blockchain Startup
Summary: A former banker who was one of the most high-profile executives to jump to the blockchain industry is stepping down as chief executive of Digital Asset.

Title: Bitcoin Wasn’t a Bubble Until It Was
Summary: Even after it soared a million percent, cryptocurrency boosters denied it was a bubble—and they weren’t wrong.

Title: Layoffs Become the Latest Thing in Cryptocurrency
Summary: Cryptocurrency companies are laying off employees in an effort to survive the nascent market’s biggest selloff to date. Blockchain venture firm ConsenSys said Thursday it plans to cut 13% of its staff.

Title: Thematic ETFs Are the Rage—Until They Fail
Summary: The funds focus on trade disputes, marijuana, AI and more, but many struggle to gain investor interest.

Title: Two Iranians Indicted in Atlanta on Cyber Crime Charges
Summary: Two men who were already indicted in New Jersey in connection with a broad cyber crime and extortion scheme now face new federal charges in Georgia.

Title: U.S. Targets Iranian Hackers for Laundering Bitcoin In Connection to Major Ransomware Attack
Summary: The U.S. Treasury Department imposed sanctions on two Iranian men the administration said laundered ransomed bitcoin from a major cyberattack that hit U.S. cities, hospitals and other critical networks.

Title: Bitcoin Continues Steep Fall as Cryptocurrency Collapse Worsens
Summary: Bitcoin slumped 10%, continuing a steep slide and bucking a modest rebound in stocks and oil.

Title: Pay Taxes With Bitcoin? Ohio Says Sure
Summary: Ohio appears set to become the first state to accept bitcoin for tax bills, a show of support for a technology that has garnered lots of hype but failed to gain traction as a form of payment.

Title: Overstock’s Founder Bets on Blockchain, Not Bedsheets
Summary: Overstock.com’s CEO doesn’t care that his blockchain-based trading system is burning through money. He remains a true believer in the technology—and its potential for multibillion-dollar returns.

Title: Bearish on Bitcoin: Crypto Markets Take Steep Dive
Summary: The price of bitcoin dropped 9% on Tuesday, a day after it fell below $5,000 for the first time since October 2017. The cryptocurrency is down 78% from its all-time high of $19,800 in December.

Title: Nvidia Grapples With Cryptocurrency Miners’ Exit
Summary: The previous stockpiling habits of cryptocurrency miners have left Nvidia to battle with excess graphics-card inventory.

Title: Cryptocurrency Hangover Weighs on Nvidia
Summary: Nvidia shares tumbled 18% after the chip maker projected declining revenue for the current quarter as it works through excess inventory left over from the cryptocurrency boom.

Title: Firm Tied to Cryptocurrency Entrepreneur Faces SEC Investigation
Summary: The SEC is investigating a company’s cryptocurrency sale, an executive with the firm said, and people familiar with the probe said it includes looking at whether a prominent bitcoin entrepreneur broke the law by getting involved with the company’s fundraising.

Title: Bitcoin Plunges Below $6,000, Hits New Lows for the Year
Summary: After 2017’s manic rally and this year’s steep plunge, cryptocurrency markets had been unusually calm in recent months. That lull has come to an end.

Title: The Calm Crypto Market? Bitcoin Volatility Drops Despite Turmoil Elsewhere
Summary: Cryptocurrencies, among the most volatile of financial assets, have fallen quiet even as turmoil has gripped stocks, bonds, commodities and traditional currencies.

Title: The Man Who Bet It All on Bitcoin, and Still Believes
Summary: In 2017, Didi Taihuttu sold almost everything he and his family owned and poured it into bitcoin. WSJ goes on a year-long journey with the “bitcoin family” as they bet everything on a decentralized cryptocurrency future, in this episode of Moving Upstream.

Title: Bitcoin Turns 10: Still Not All Grown Up
Summary: Wednesday marks the 10th birthday of bitcoin. As the digital currency has grown over the years, it has become a source of fascination for investors, speculators, true believers and skeptics. However, it hasn’t become the one thing it was built to be: a payments system.

Title: Can Bitcoin Become a Dominant Currency?
Summary: A debate: One expert says there’s a consumer need for an alternative currency; the other says cryptocurrencies will remain mostly in the hands of speculators.

Title: Fidelity Says It Will Trade Bitcoin for Hedge Funds
Summary: Fidelity Investments said it will store and trade digital currencies for hedge funds and other professional investors, becoming one of the first Wall Street giants to step into this volatile corner of the financial world.

Title: Plan to Fix Journalism With Cryptocurrency Draws Skepticism
Summary: The Civil Media Co. bills itself as a solution to some pressing problems in modern journalism, pitching a new cryptocurrency that would help news consumers support quality information and weed out bad actors.

Title: Cryptocurrencies, Trading Scams Draw Increased Federal Enforcement
Summary: Enforcement actions and fines by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission ticked up in the last fiscal year, buoyed by cryptocurrency cases, spoofing schemes and settlements dating back to the financial crisis.

Title: TD Ameritrade and High-Speed Traders Back New Crypto Exchange
Summary: The launch of ErisX comes as trueEX plans a bitcoin swap in the latest market embrace of digital currency.

Title: WSJCoin: Yes, We Created Our Own Cryptocurrency
Summary: To understand what drives the wild cryptocurrency market, we decided to experiment with a digital currency of our own: WSJCoin, a virtual token for the newspaper industry.

Title: Bots Are Manipulating Price of Bitcoin in ‘Wild West of Crypto’
Summary: Investors know bitcoin’s violent mood swings well. What they often don’t know is that unscrupulous traders, wielding purpose-built software, can be behind them.

Title: Bitcoin’s 10th Birthday Won’t Be a Happy One
Summary: Cryptocurrency prices have hit the skids this year after bitcoin soared nearly 1,400% in 2017.

Title: Crypto Meets Wall Street as Bitcoin Mining Giant Bitmain Files for IPO
Summary: Bitmain, the world’s largest cryptocurrency mining company, is planning to pursue an initial public offering in Hong Kong, one of the first major instances where the traditional capital markets and the newer cryptocurrency world will collide.

Title: This Crypto Mining IPO Looks as Risky as Crypto Trading
Summary: Bitmain, the world’s largest cryptocurrency-mining equipment maker, has filed for an IPO in Hong Kong. Its business model looks just as open to volatility as cryptocurrencies.

Title: Bitcoin ETFs Keep Trying, Despite Regulators’ Rejections
Summary: The SEC has said no at least 10 times. But firms want to be ready, just in case the regulators change their minds.

Title: Another Cryptocurrency Exchange Hacked, About $60 Million Swiped
Summary: A Japanese cryptocurrency exchange operator said about $60 million worth of bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies were stolen from its platform, the latest heist highlighting the vulnerability of such exchanges.

Title: Crypto Pioneer David Chaum Says He’s Built a Better Bitcoin
Summary: David Chaum, the godfather of the cryptocurrency movement, is back with a plan to address bitcoin’s biggest shortcoming: speed.

Title: Anatomy of a Cryptojacking
Summary: How criminals are using hijacked computers to earn cryptocurrency.

Title: Cryptocurrency Exchanges Are Vulnerable to Manipulation, Report Finds
Summary: A number of cryptocurrency exchanges lack basic consumer protections and are vulnerable to exploitation by market manipulators, the New York Attorney General’s office said in a report Tuesday.

Title: ‘Crypto Tourists’ Flee as Bitcoin Slump Drags On
Summary: The value of cryptocurrencies has tumbled 76% after exceeding $800 billion earlier this year as the largest digital currency, bitcoin, fails to shake off its months-long decline.

Title: Goldman Tables Crypto Desk
Summary: Goldman Sachs changes its mind on cryptocurrency trading.

Title: It Was Meant to Be the Better Bitcoin. It’s Down Nearly 90%
Summary: The underperformance of Bitcoin Cash touches on a larger question: Can virtual currencies really become a means of payment that would supplant traditional money?

Title: China Is Getting Even Tougher on Cryptocurrencies a Year After Its Crackdown
Summary: China is tightening its clampdown on cryptocurrencies, nearly a year after the government imposed a wide-ranging ban on local exchanges and fundraising for digital currencies.

Title: Nvidia Clears Its Crypto Cloud
Summary: A volatile crypto market has been a distraction for the chip maker—and its investors.

Title: Cryptocurrency Market Plumbs New Depths in 2018
Summary: A broad investor retreat has pushed the market for digital currencies down 70% from its January high, reflecting user frustration over their modest inroads into commerce and a general shakeout in speculative investments.

Title: The Mystery Behind Tether, the Crypto World’s Digital Dollar
Summary: A fast-growing digital currency that claims to be backed by U.S. dollars has become a cornerstone of the volatile cryptocurrency market. The problem: There isn’t hard evidence the cash supporting it exists.

Title: The Man Who Solved Bitcoin’s Most Notorious Heist
Summary: Rampant thefts are taking the shine off cryptocurrencies. After the massive Mt. Gox exchange hack, Kim Nilsson decided to fight back.

Title: Iranian Hackers Turn to Ransomware, Bitcoin as Economy Stalls
Summary: Over the past two years, researchers have tracked five new types of so-called ransomware they say were built by hackers in Iran.

Title: NYSE’s Owner to Launch Bitcoin Firm, Futures Contracts
Summary: The New York Stock Exchange’s owner, ICE, is launching a new bitcoin company and futures contracts based on the digital currency.

Title: SEC Rejects Winklevoss Bitcoin ETF Proposal
Summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission has denied an application for an exchange-traded fund that would track the price of bitcoin, the latest indication that regulators are still uneasy with the cryptocurrency market.

Title: Is Bitcoin Back? Cryptocurrency Crosses $8,000 for First Time in Two Months
Summary: The price of bitcoin jumped above $8,000, extending a rally that has lifted the largest cryptocurrency by market value to its highest level in two months.

Title: Will Bitcoin Save Us From Google?
Summary: Maybe the seeds of destruction already have been planted at the search giant.

Title: How Bitcoin Fueled Russian Hacks
Summary: The Russian intelligence officers charged with hacking into the Democratic National Committee and Hillary Clinton’s 2016 presidential campaign used bitcoin to finance and obscure their operations, according to an indictment obtained by special counsel Robert Mueller’s office.

Title: New York Stock Exchange Executive to Join Winklevoss Bitcoin Firm
Summary: A bitcoin exchange has hired the New York Stock Exchange’s top technology executive—Robert Cornish—the latest sign that cryptocurrency trading platforms are seeking to look more like traditional markets.

Title: A Fifth of All Bitcoin Is Missing. These Crypto Hunters Can Help
Summary: A new crop of digital sleuths is working with investors and law enforcement to find misplaced or inaccessible cryptocurrency.

Title: What Crypto Downturn? ICO Fundraising Surges in 2018
Summary: A regulatory crackdown has failed to derail initial coin offerings, a controversial fundraising method.

Title: This Company Helps Bitcoin Millionaires Unleash Their Fortunes
Summary: You generally can’t pay bills or buy stocks with cryptocurrency, unless you exchange it and risk missing out on future upswings. A new lending platform called Salt offers a high-interest solution.

Title: Court Blocks Payday for Chief of Bankrupt Mt. Gox Bitcoin Exchange
Summary: Creditors in Mt. Gox, a bitcoin exchange that collapsed in February 2014, are in line for a bigger payday after blocking a liquidation that could have netted former exchange chief Mark Karpelès hundreds of millions of dollars.

Title: Is Bitcoin the Future, or an Echo of a Failed Past?
Summary: Digital currencies remind some of the spread of private money in the early 19th century.

Title: Bitcoin Pushes Ancient Gold Market to Try Digital
Summary: Some makers and sellers of gold coins and bars are turning to blockchain, the digital ledger that underpins bitcoin, hoping to add some cryptocurrency luster to bullion trading.

Title: Ether Shouldn’t Be Subject to SEC Regulation, Official Says
Summary: Ether, a cryptocurrency on par with bitcoin, isn’t subject to the extensive investor-protection rules the U.S. securities regulator enforces.
